intro: Wahlenbergia lasiocarpa, commonly known as the silverleaf scabious, is a flowering plant native to southern Africa. It is a member of the Campanulaceae family and is characterized by its delicate, blue to purple flowers. The plant typically grows in rocky or sandy soils and thrives in full sun. Its leaves are covered in fine, silvery hairs, giving it its common name. Wahlenbergia lasiocarpa is often cultivated for its ornamental value in gardens.
